name: ACT Open Source projects & tools
author: Multiple
format: ESA Advanced Concepts Team (ACT) resources for Open Sources projects and tools. Together with the introduction of the github and the gitlab dedicated channels for the European Space Agency and the of specific programmes such as SOCIS (the ESA summer of code in space), the ACT, over the years, developed and is now maintaining a number of open source projects that are put at the service of a wider community.

name: Android Raw GNSS Measurement
author: Google
format: GnssLogger source code in Matlab, but you don’t need Matlab to use it

name: Apache Spark
author: Apache Software Foundation
format: Standalone cluster mode, on EC2, on Hadoop YARN, on Mesos, or on Kubernetes.

name: Apache Storm
author: Apache Software Foundation
format: Implemented in Java, can be used with any programming language

name: ArcGIS Desktop
scope: Data Stores, ETL, GIS, Metadata management, Navigation and Maps, Spatial Tools

name: ArcGIS for INSPIRE
scope: ETL, Metadata management, Spatial Tools, Web Servers

name: BKG Ntrip Software
author: Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy (BKG)
format: Source and Executable for Linux, Solaris, Windows and macOS

name: CGRAN
author: Satellite communications
format: The Comprehensive GNU Radio Archive Network (CGRAN) is a free open source repository for 3rd party GNU Radio applications (a.k.a Out Of Tree Modules) that are not officially supported by the GNU Radio project. Licensed under CC BY 4.0. For Linux OS.

name: CNES Software Catalogue
author: Multiple
format: The "Centre National d'Études Spatiales" has produced various software for the space projects. This software covers a broad range of topics, from normalization to space dynamics and simulation tools. Some were developed to support CNES internal needs and are now available to the public.

name: CSRS-PPP
author: Canadian Geodetic Survey (CGS)
format: Executable online or as a desktop application. Supports RINEX files

name: DIMITRI - Database for Imaging Multi-spectral Instruments and Tools for Radiometric Intercomparison
author: ESA, ARGANS, Magellium
format: Source code, compatible with Linux, Windows and macOS

name: ESA Earth online portal
author: Earth observation
format: List of software tools supported by ESA for Earth Observation

name: ESA STEP
author: Earth observation
format: ESA is developing free open source toolboxes for the scientific exploitation of Earth Observation missions under the the Scientific Exploitation of Operational Missions (SEOM) programme element. STEP is the ESA community platform for accessing the software and its documentation, communicating with the developers, dialoguing within the science community, promoting results and achievements as well as providing tutorials and material for training scientists using the Toolboxes.

name: Elasticsearch and Kibana
author: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
format: Docker images, RPM files, and Debian files

name: European Space Software Repository
author: Multiple
format: ESA informational web portal created to promote reuse of Software - including Open Source Software (OSS) - and to provide all parties involved in the European Space software development (in particular SMEs) with access to results of previous investments. Registration available to ESA member states.

name: Eurostat grid generation tool for ArcGIS
scope: Domain Specific GIS, GIS, Spatial Tools

name: GDAL
author: GDAL community
format: Source and binaries for Windows, Debian and containers

name: GDAL Geospatial Data Abstraction Library
language: Perl, Python, VB6 Binding, GDAL binding into R, Ruby, Java, C#

name: GNSS-SDR
author: CTTC
format: Source code and libs for Linux Debian, macOS. Runs on GNU Radio

name: GPSTk
author: Applied Research Laboratories at the University of Texas at Austin

name: GRASS GIS - Geographic Resources Analysis Support System
author: GRASS GIS developers community
format: Stand-alone application or backend for other software packages

name: GeMA - Gestor de Metadados dos Açores
GeoJSON
author: Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), in conjunction with the original specification authors.

name: GeoServer
author: Open Source Geospatial Foundation
format: Supports WFS, WMS and WCS standards

name: Google Earth Engine

format: The Earth Engine (EE) API is available in Python and JavaScript.

name: INSPIRE Solution Pack for FME Server
ION GNSS SDR Standard
author: GNSS
format: The GNSS SDR Metadata Standard defines parameters and schema to express the contents of SDR sample data files. The standard is designed to promote the interoperability of GNSS SDR data collection systems and processors.

name: Josm
scope: Navigation and Maps, Other, Spatial Tools

name: MACCS/MAJA
author: CNES and CESBIO
format: Language: C++, Python and Cmake. OS:Linux RedHat 6+, CENTOS 6+ Ubuntu 12.04+

name: Microsoft CNTK

format: Toolkit compatible with Linux and Windows

name: MongoDB
author: MongoDB Inc.
format: Source and Executable (Windows, Linux, macOS, Solaris, FreeBSD)

name: NOAA collection of GPS software
author: GNSS
format: Site is running since 1999. The main purpose of this site is to provide a means for distributing the source code and algorithms discussed in the GPS Toolbox column.

name: NVIDIA DIGITS
author: NVIDIA
license: Free after joining the NVIDIA Developer Program

name: NodeJS
author: Node.js is a trademark of Joyent, Inc

name: OSGEO
author: Earth observation
format: The Open Source Geospatial Foundation (OSGeo) is a not-for-profit organization whose mission is to foster global adoption of open geospatial technology by being an inclusive software foundation devoted to an open philosophy and participatory community driven development.

name: On-Line Geodesy Resources
author: Earth observation
format: A personal collection of geodesy and related resources on the Web. Created by Mike Craymer.

name: Open Data Cube

format: Collection of software base on Python library

name: OpenCV
author: Intel
format: C++ library for Windows, Linux, macOS, FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD...

name: OpenDEM
author: Earth observation
format: List of free Digital Elevation Models. This project will focus on free high resolution datasets with a spatial resolution of 30 meters and below on county/state scale.

format: It compiles and runs on a wide variety of UNIX platforms, Windows and macOS.

name: RTL-SDR Software
author: Signal processing
format: RTL-SDR is a USB dongle based on the RTL2832U chipset, for which many SDR software have been developped for different applications (not only satellite)

format: Python libraries for Linux, macOS and Windows

name: SensLog
scope: Data Stores, Spatial Tools, Web Servers

name: Sentinel Hub
author: Earth observation
format:
Sentinel Hub is operated by Sinergise - a GIS IT company with more than 10 years of experience in working with spatial data.
Different applications are available online.
The satellite imagery distribution service is based on Sinergise's cloud GIS platform - Geopedia - web based spatial management solution, which is being used by more than one million users annualy and is therefore perfectly suitable for large scale spatial deployments.

name: Spatineo Monitor
scope: Metadata management, Other, Web Servers, WebGIS

format: Executable (Windows, macOS, Linux…). Supports RINEX and BINEX formats

author: Earth observation
format: References more than 350 open source software for processing of Earth Observation data, with categorisation and graph representation

name: UNAVCO software
author: GNSS
format: Web-based data visualization and mapping tools provide users with the ability to view post–processed data while web-based geodetic utilities provide ancillary information.

format: Library, for Python, R, Java, Scala, C++ and more. Runs on single machine, Hadoop, Spark, Flink and DataFlow.
